parallel.distributed

Class DAccumulatorClt

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.distributed.DAccumulatorClt

  • public class DAccumulatorClt
extends java.lang.Object
    class implementing clients for sending accumulating numbers between threads living in distributed JVMs (or for asking the current min/max/sum value among the received numbers). A thread wishing to send a number(s) invokes the addNumber[s](data) method of the client. A client wishing to receive the minimum value currently stored on the accumulating server, calls the getMinValue().

    Clients may also register their interest in receiving updates on new min or max values accumulated in the server by calling the method registerListener(popt4jlib.ObserverIntf obs, int not_type); in such a case, the obs object's notifyChange(SubjectIntf) method will be invoked whenever a new min or max value is accumulated on the server, with parameter the updating thread of this client. The client is thread-safe (essentially serialized).

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2016

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) static class  DAccumulatorClt.AsynchUpdateThread
      auxiliary thread class is responsible for opening a connection to the DAccumulatorSrv's notification-port, and listening for incoming numbers representing new (min or max) incumbents.

    • Method Detail

      • setHostPort

        public static void setHostPort(java.lang.String host,
                               int port,
                               java.lang.String notificationshost,
                               int notificationsport)
                        throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        method specifies the host and port where the accumulator server lives, as well as the accumulator notifications server.
        Parameters:
        host - String the address of the DAccumulatorSrv or any other FwdSrv connected to the accumulator server
        port - int
        notificationshost - String may be the DAccumulatorSrv or any other BCastSrv connected to the accumulator server
        notificationsport - int if < 0, the client does not register an interest in notifications, otherwise, if < 1024 the default port is used.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException

      • registerListener

        public static void registerListener(ObserverIntf observer,
                                    int notification_type)
        method must be called only once; it starts the DAccumulatorClt.AsynchUpdateThread thread that will first send to the notifications server the type of notifications this client is interested in, and then will keep listening for double values representing new accumulated incumbents (new min or max values).
        Parameters:
        observer - ObserverIntf the object that will be receiving the notifications, ie this object's notifyChange() method will be called each time a new value arrives from the socket
        notification_type - int allowed values are the declared DAccumulatorNotificationType constants
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called more than once
